sentence.Network_en: Brevet is a form of military commission formerly used in US armies.
sentence.Network_cn: 名誉晋升是美军曾用的一种军衔.

sentence.Network_en: Judges with an international brevet are integral to the development of Acrobatic Gymnastics.
sentence.Network_cn: 国际裁判员要全身心地为发展技巧运动服务.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 临时军衔，最早来源于“名誉晋级”(Brevet)，起源于拉丁语brevis (短暂的)。早在 1600年，英国人用名誉晋级一词，表示临时提高一个 …
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(B) ... breve 短音符 brevet 名誉晋升 breviary 每日祈祷书.

list.abs: 3. 证书,专利证Vous avez déjà obtenu le brevet de vos études dans notre université ?你们已经获得在我校的毕业证书了吗?4. <转>保证,保障un.
promote somebody by brevet , in the military ., 在军队中通过加军衔提升某人.
he quickly earned a reputation for toughness and bravery , and by the war's end in 1848 he held the rank of brevet major .因为顽强和勇敢，他迅速地赢得了名声，在1848年战争结束的时候他已经晋升为陆军少校。
The organizers must obligatorily use the brevet card of their own geographical area ., 主办单位仅得使用该区域的资格卡.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (denoting an official letter, especially a papal indulgence): from Old French brievet 'little letter', diminutive of bref

means.word_mean: 1. a document entitling a commissioned officer to hold a higher rank temporarily (but without higher pay)
1. promote somebody by brevet, in the military
